result.execSummary:
The defendant Tavares Maurice Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges.   DOC to collect from 25% of funds per Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  Failure to pay by the end of Extended supervision will result in a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: No use of controlled substances. To report any prescriptions to agent prior to filing the prescription.
Obey all rules as set forth by  DOC.

supervisions.notes: Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession, voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tavares Maurice Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCE Transcript (28 pages) commencing MAY 8, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Tavares Maurice Johnson in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Defendant Tavares Maurice Johnson in custody.  Karyn E Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Parties are ready to proceed.
Defendant sworn in.
As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Tavares Maurice Johnson not in court, in custody.  Karyn E. Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 5/8/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of a PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing on 03-12-2014 received and filed. (25 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to ASSISTANT STATE PUBLIC DEFENDER STEPHEN SARGENT, 819 N 6th Street, 9th Floor, Milwaukee, WI  53203..
Scheduling conference scheduled for 03-24-2014 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Branch 15.

Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15 for scheduling conference.

Defendant Tavares Maurice Johnson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Tavares Maurice Johnson in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy, appearing for Kevin Shomin, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  City of Milwaukee Police Dept. Officer Michael Bachmann.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding Case #09CF000185 that are already attached to the complaint.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.
Clerk:  jms

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Tavares Maurice Johnson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Tavares Maurice Johnson in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
